channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2025040639
item.description:
Report E-2025040639

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-02
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pail leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. The paint dried so Dayton Freight personnel did not need to deploy granular absorbents to the impacted area. They gathered the damaged pail and containerized it into one (1) 8-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
